page.title: 06Lympstone-largest village.
page.content: This is a picturesque estuary village and old fishing port.It appeared in the Domesday Book as Leustona and is of Anglo-Saxon origin.When there were two settlements-a fishing one and farming one near the church.Trade with Holland and wealth acquired through wool is shown by some imposing houses and the use of Dutch bricks,originally ballast. The village is now linear in shape running without a break from the shore to the A376 for about 1km.Post war growth has been to the north and south of the village road and it is now a thriving settlement with an active community life,railway linked to Exeter large commuter population and attractive selection of buildings of varying styles and ages.
